tabfields.helpertext: Important: The Information if a user as seen the banner is stored in cookie which is not resetted, when deactivating this plugin. If you want to reset user settings you can rename the cookie name.
tabfields.name: Enable Cookie Banner

tabfields.helpertext: If checked you see the banner in the settings section and your consent cookie will be deleted with every admin page view. So you can see the banner more often in the frontend.
tabfields.name: Preview Banner

tabfields.helpertext: If checked, the events 'beautiful_cookie_consent_initialized' and 'beautiful_cookie_consent_updated' will pushed in your dataLayer after consent or a change of consent.
tabfields.name: Push consent event to dataLayer

tabfields.helpertext: Caution: only change if you know what you are doing. If you have renamed your default GTM dataLayer you can put the new name here. To this dataLayer the event will pushed.
tabfields.name: DataLayer name

tabfields.helpertext: In Safari and Firefox cookies set by javascript are only valid for 7 days. As consequence your user will see the banner every 7 days, which can be annoying. By checking this option, the cookie is converted to a backend cookie and the defined expiration is restored. Default expiration is 365 days.
tabfields.name: Cookie ITP 2.1 resilient (use backend cookie)

tabfields.helpertext: Add you desired Fonts name here, e.g. 'Catamaran-Regular', sans-serif. Please be aware that these fonts should be loaded already. You can only use already existing fonts here. It won't install them.

tabfields.pre_selected_value: This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.
tabfields.name: Text for Banner

selectable_values.name: Just tell the user we use cookies.

tabfields.helpertext: If you use 'Differentiated Consent', 'Opt-in' or 'Opt-out' you must make sure, that all plugins and features of your site respect that setting, this is not part of this plugin. More info see documentation link above. The user setting can be found in the cookie, set by this plugin. The difference between opt-in and opt-out is at the moment only the display of the shortcode [cc_revoke_settings_link_nsc_bar], if the user had no action taken, yet.
tabfields.name: Compliance Type

tabfields.helpertext: Specify the different cookie types. Cookie Suffix: each cookie type gets an own cookie to save the acceptance status. The name is '<cookiename>'_'cookie suffix'.
tabfields.name: Cookie Types

tabfields.helpertext: Per default the button which set the widest consent is highlighted, this can be considered as dark pattern. For some regulations it is neccesary, that both have an equal weight. When ticking this box, they have some size and color.
tabfields.name: Make the buttons look equal

tabfields.helpertext: Only for 'Differentiated Consent': It might be useful to have the configured default setting on first page view in a cookie, before any user interaction. Depending on your compliance requirements, it might be a legal issue.
tabfields.name: Set cookies with default values on 1st page view

tabfields.helpertext: To disable, leave empty. To enable, set to the number of pixels a user must scroll vertically in order to trigger the dismiss.
tabfields.name: Allow on scroll

tabfields.helpertext: To disable, leave empty. To enable set value as time in milliseconds to autodismiss after set time.
tabfields.name: Allow on timeout (ms)

tabfields.helpertext: Not working in admin preview! Only in frontend. Depending on your tracking set up, you might need a reload of the page after an opt in to track the page on which the user opted in.
tabfields.name: Reload after Bannerclick

tabfields.helpertext: If this is checked the banner will appear on the next page again, until the user accepts cookies. In case of 'differentiated consent' the user must accept all cookie types.
tabfields.name: Ask until acceptance

tabfields.helpertext: Activate this, to block the page content, until the banner is closed. You force the user to make a choice.
tabfields.name: Block Page, if Banner shown

tabfields.helpertext: Show tab at the bottom to give users the possibilty to change cookie settings.
tabfields.name: Show 'Cookie Settings' tab

tabfields.helpertext: Text of the small tab at the botton, once user had made a cookie choice.
tabfields.name: Text for 'Cookie Settings' tab

tabfields.helpertext: Text for link for showing the banner again. Nice to give user ability to manage their settings without displaying the settings tab. To display the link use this shortcode: [cc_show_cookie_banner_nsc_bar]
tabfields.name: Shortcode: Link text 'show banner'

tabfields.helpertext: You can leave it empty. If you do so, the current domain where the banner is clicked is used as cookie domain. Be careful: if changing the domain all users will see the banner again, because their cookie gets 'resetted'.
